description: Contains information about each account, including its creation date, location, and frequency of statement issuance.
summary: This table holds the primary details for each bank account. Key fields include the unique `account_id`, the `district_id` linking to the branch's location, and the `frequency` of statement generation which can be monthly, weekly, or after a transaction.

columns.name: account_id
columns.description: The ID of the account.

columns.name: date
columns.description: The creation date of the account in the form YYMMDD.

columns.name: district_id
columns.description: Location of the branch, foreign key to the district table.

columns.name: frequency
columns.description: Frequency of account statement issuance. 'POPLATEK MESICNE' stands for monthly issuance, 'POPLATEK TYDNE' stands for weekly issuance, 'POPLATEK PO OBRATU' stands for issuance after a transaction.

description: Details about credit cards issued to clients, including card type and issue date.
summary: This table lists all credit cards associated with dispositions. Each card is identified by `card_id` and linked to a disposition via `disp_id`. The `type` column categorizes the card ('junior', 'classic', 'gold'), and `issued` tracks the issuance date.

columns.name: card_id
columns.description: ID number of the credit card.

columns.name: disp_id
columns.description: Disposition ID, foreign key to the disposition table.

columns.name: type
columns.description: Type of credit card: 'junior', 'classic', or 'gold'.

columns.name: issued
columns.description: The date when the credit card was issued in the form YYMMDD.

description: Contains personal information about the bank's clients.
summary: This table stores demographic information for each client, identified by `client_id`. It includes `gender`, `birth_date`, and the `district_id` for their location.

columns.name: client_id
columns.description: The unique number for the client.

columns.name: gender
columns.description: Gender of the client: 'F' for female, 'M' for male.

columns.name: birth_date
columns.description: The birth date of the client.

columns.name: district_id
columns.description: Location of the branch, foreign key to the district table.

description: Links clients to accounts and specifies their rights (e.g., owner, disponent).
summary: This table acts as a mapping between clients and their accounts, using `disp_id` as the unique key. It links `client_id` to `account_id` and defines the client's role through the `type` column ('OWNER', 'DISPONENT').

columns.name: disp_id
columns.description: Unique number identifying this row of the record.

columns.name: client_id
columns.description: ID number of the client, foreign key to the client table.

columns.name: account_id
columns.description: ID number of the account, foreign key to the account table.

columns.name: type
columns.description: Type of disposition. 'OWNER' or 'DISPONENT'. A DISPONENT can issue permanent orders or apply for loans.

description: Provides demographic and economic statistics for different districts.
summary: This table contains socio-economic data for each district, identified by `district_id`. It includes information like `district_name`, `region`, population statistics, `average_salary`, `unemployment_rate`, and crime statistics for 1995 and 1996.

columns.name: district_id
columns.description: Unique identifier for the district.

columns.name: district_name
columns.description: Name of the district.

columns.name: region
columns.description: The region the district belongs to.

columns.name: number_of_inhabitants
columns.description: Total number of inhabitants in the district.

columns.name: municipalities_lt_499_inhabitants
columns.description: Number of municipalities with inhabitants fewer than 499.

columns.name: municipalities_500_to_1999_inhabitants
columns.description: Number of municipalities with inhabitants between 500 and 1999.

columns.name: municipalities_2000_to_9999_inhabitants
columns.description: Number of municipalities with inhabitants between 2000 and 9999.

columns.name: municipalities_gt_10000_inhabitants
columns.description: Number of municipalities with inhabitants greater than 10000.

columns.name: cities
columns.description: Number of cities in the district.

columns.name: ratio_of_urban_inhabitants
columns.description: The ratio of urban inhabitants in the district.

columns.name: average_salary
columns.description: The average salary in the district.

columns.name: unemployment_rate_95
columns.description: The unemployment rate in 1995.

columns.name: unemployment_rate_96
columns.description: The unemployment rate in 1996.

columns.name: entrepreneurs_per_1000_inhabitants
columns.description: The number of entrepreneurs per 1000 inhabitants.

columns.name: committed_crimes_95
columns.description: The number of committed crimes in 1995.

columns.name: committed_crimes_96
columns.description: The number of committed crimes in 1996.

description: Contains information about approved loans for accounts.
summary: This table tracks all loans issued, identified by `loan_id`. It links to an `account_id` and details the loan's `amount`, `duration` in months, monthly `payments`, and its current `status` (e.g., finished, running, in debt).

columns.name: loan_id
columns.description: The ID number identifying the loan data.

columns.name: account_id
columns.description: The ID number identifying the account, foreign key to the account table.

columns.name: date
columns.description: The date when the loan was approved.

columns.name: amount
columns.description: Approved loan amount in US dollars.

columns.name: duration
columns.description: Loan duration in months.

columns.name: payments
columns.description: Monthly payment amount in US dollars.

columns.name: status
columns.description: Repayment status: 'A' for contract finished, no problems; 'B' for contract finished, loan not paid; 'C' for running contract, OK so far; 'D' for running contract, client in debt.

description: Contains information about permanent (standing) orders from accounts.
summary: This table logs standing orders, identified by `order_id`. Each order is linked to an `account_id` and specifies the recipient's bank (`bank_to`) and account (`account_to`), the `amount`, and the purpose of the payment (`k_symbol`).

columns.name: order_id
columns.description: Unique identifier for the order.

columns.name: account_id
columns.description: ID number of the account, foreign key to the account table.

columns.name: bank_to
columns.description: Bank of the recipient. Each bank has a unique two-letter code.

columns.name: account_to
columns.description: Account number of the recipient.

columns.name: amount
columns.description: Debited amount.

columns.name: k_symbol
columns.description: Characterization of the payment: 'POJISTNE' for insurance payment, 'SIPO' for household payment, 'LEASING' for leasing, 'UVER' for loan payment.

summary: This table provides a detailed log of all transactions, each identified by `trans_id`. It includes the `account_id`, `date`, `type` (credit/withdrawal), `operation` mode, `amount`, and the resulting `balance`. It also characterizes the transaction's purpose via `k_symbol`.

columns.name: trans_id
columns.description: Transaction ID.

columns.name: account_id
columns.description: ID number of the account, foreign key to the account table.

columns.name: date
columns.description: Date of the transaction.

columns.name: type
columns.description: Type of transaction: 'PRIJEM' for credit, 'VYDAJ' for withdrawal.

columns.name: operation
columns.description: Mode of transaction: 'VYBER KARTOU' for credit card withdrawal, 'VKLAD' for credit in cash, 'PREVOD Z UCTU' for collection from another bank, 'VYBER' for withdrawal in cash, 'PREVOD NA UCET' for remittance to another bank.

columns.name: amount
columns.description: Amount of money in USD.

columns.name: balance
columns.description: Balance after the transaction in USD.

columns.name: k_symbol
columns.description: Characterization of the transaction: 'POJISTNE' for insurance payment, 'SLUZBY' for payment for statement, 'UROK' for interest credited, 'SANKC. UROK' for sanction interest on a negative balance, 'SIPO' for household, 'DUCHOD' for old-age pension, 'UVER' for loan payment.

columns.name: bank
columns.description: Bank of the transaction partner. Each bank has a unique two-letter code.

columns.name: account
columns.description: Account of the transaction partner.
